title: Government must clarify truth on USD 200 million: Gammanpila
byline: The government must reveal the truth about whether President Anura Kumara Dissanayaka or the World Bank (WB) is being truthful regarding the USD 200 million loan obtained from the WB, former Minister Udaya Gammanpila said.

title: Train strike called off
byline: The Sri Lanka Railways Station Masters’ Union (SLRSMU) has decided to call off their ongoing trade union strike as of 10 p.m tonight.

title: Rice prices average above rate stipulated by Govt
byline: Despite the government regulating prices for Nadu rice at Rs. 220, prices have averaged Rs.235 a kilo in the market, according to recent reports.

title: Bird flu detected in a pig for the first time in the U.S., raising concerns
byline: Bird flu has been found in at least one pig at a backyard farm in Oregon, the first detection of the H5N1 virus in swine in the United States, the U.S. Agriculture Department said Wednesday.

title: ’Army Chooty’ arrested for managing Harak Kata’s drug operations
byline: The Police Special Task Force (STF) arrested an underworld figure known as ’Army Chooty’ who manages the drug operations of Nandun Chintaka Wickremaratne, alias ‘Harak Kata,’ revealing an extensive drug trafficking network.

title: Over half of drugs failing quality tests are in India
byline: More than half of the drugs that have failed quality tests so far in 2024 originated from India, according to the Medical Supplies Division of the Health Ministry.

title: Some politicians, media institutions spreading false news to create anarchy: President
byline: Some politicians and media institutions are spreading false news to create anarchy in the country with an intention to create instability without giving the new government strong power, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said yesterday.

title: Ex-President misled state employees on salary hike says Prime Minister
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya recently claimed that the former President deliberately misled state employees by promising them a salary hike.

title: RPCs raise Deepavali festival advances for plantation workforce by up to 25%
byline: The Planters’ Association of Ceylon (PA) yesterday said that the Regional Plantation Companies (RPCs) have raised the festival advances for their workers, with the increase beginning ahead of this year’s Deepavali holiday.

title: Price drops continue to cool Colombo inflation in October
byline: Inflation in Sri Lanka’s Colombo district fell further in October, marking the third consecutive month of easing, with both food and non-food prices declining amid the improved supply conditions and reduced administrative costs, according to the data from the Census and Statistics Department.

title: Customs achieve more than 80% by end October – Spokesman
byline: Sri Lanka Customs, one of the three main revenue generating arms of the Treasury, had achieved more than 80% of the stipulated revenue target of Rs.1.53 trillion for the year 2024 by end of October, with positive hopes of surpassing the aim before 2025, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Sri Lanka’s construction activity slips in September
byline: Sri Lanka’s construction sector reported a contraction in September, reflecting a slowdown in the activities, influenced by the election-related disruptions, the data from the Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) showed on Monday.

title: Lohan Ratwatte arrested
byline: Former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte was arrested by police a short while ago.

title: Examinations Department must assure smooth conduct of 2024 A/L exams: CTU
byline: The Examinations Department must assure students and parents that the 2024 GCE Advanced Level (A/L) examinations will be conducted smoothly, without any issues, Ceylon Teachers’ Union (CTU) General Secretary Joseph Stalin said.

title: Light Diwali of wisdom this year: President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake in his Diwali message emphasised the importance of a cultural, political, and attitudinal transformation if Sri Lankans are to realize hope of a prosperous country and a fulfilling life for all.

title: Russian Customs sign MoU with Sri Lankan counterpart to curb illegal trade
byline: The Sri Lanka Customs entered into a mutual agreement with its Russian counterpart to counter illegal trading activities and to boost legal trade facilities between the two nations in the future, an official said.

title: Spanish floods kill 95 as year of rain falls in a day
byline: At least 95 people have been killed in possibly the deadliest flooding to hit Spain in its modern history after torrential rain battered the eastern region of Valencia, sweeping away bridges and buildings, local authorities said on Wednesday.

title: Failing to represent client as assigned counsel: Supreme Court suspends lawyer for five years
byline: In a landmark disciplinary action, the Supreme Court suspended a lawyer from practicing law for five years following findings that he failed to appear before the High Court in a criminal matter where he was appointed as the assigned counsel by court.

title: ’Why should I take advice from someone rejected by people 17 times?’: Harini responds to Ranil
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya said she will never take advice from someone like former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who was rejected by the people 17 times.
